Sentencas: Yttria-stabilized zirconia, YSZ, is the oxide ion conducting electrolyte of choice in many solid oxide fuel cells, because of its resistance to reduction at the fuel electrode.
Titulo: Electronic Conductivity in Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia under a Small dc Bias

Sentencas: Here, we demonstrate that electronic conduction is introduced into YSZ under the action of a small dc bias at high temperatures in air.
Titulo: Electronic Conductivity in Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia under a Small dc Bias

Sentencas: A reversible decrease in sample grain and grain boundary resistances occurs with increasing bias in the range 1-15 V and the Warburg impedance at the sample-electrode-air interface collapses.
Titulo: Electronic Conductivity in Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia under a Small dc Bias

Sentencas: Similar conductivity changes are seen with acceptor-doped dielectrics and are attributed to the ionization of underbonded oxide ions in the crystal structure, with O-
Titulo: Electronic Conductivity in Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia under a Small dc Bias

Sentencas: ions acting as the location of the holes and the source of p-type conduction; the ionized electrons are trapped by changes to the equilibria among oxygen species at the sample surface.
Titulo: Electronic Conductivity in Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia under a Small dc Bias

Sentencas: A similar mechanism may explain the onset of electronic conductivity in YSZ.
Titulo: Electronic Conductivity in Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia under a Small dc Bias
